title: Gyroelongated triangular cupola
summary: In geometry, the gyroelongated triangular cupola is one of the Johnson solids  (J22). It can be constructed by attaching a hexagonal antiprism to the base of a triangular cupola (J3).  This is called "gyroelongation", which means that an antiprism is joined to the base of a solid, or between the bases of more than one solid.
